page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF THE BLOCK
page.content: THIS IS AN AREA OF FLAT, PREDOMINANTLY ARABLE FARMLAND, IN PARTS OF HUMBERSIDE, NORTH YORKSHIRE AND SOUTH YORKSHIRE, AND IN THE PARISHES OF POLLINGTON, BALNE, SYKEHOUSE AND FENWICK. IT IS CROSSED BY THE RIVER WENT WHICH FORMS THE BOUNDARY BETWEEN NORTH AND SOUTH YORKSHIRE. TRADITIONALLY CATTLE ARE GRAZED ON THE RIVER BANKS. UP TO WORLD WAR II THERE WAS CONSIDERABLY MORE TREE COVER, BUT DURING THE WAR MUCH WAS REMOVED, USING LABOUR PROVIDED BY GERMAN PRISONERS OF WAR, MAKING MORE LAND AVAILABLE FOR GROWING FOOD. THE AREA IS SPARSELY POPULATED _ DWELLINGS BEING MAINLY LARGE FARMSTEADS, AND COTTAGES FOR AGRICULTURAL WORKERS. STRICT PLANNING CONTROLS HAVE MEANT THAT THERE ARE ALMOST NO RECENTLY BUILT HOUSES.
